It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest undergrowth, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tulotis sonoharae is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
